sec.p: Dried pumpkin seed samples were ground using a kitchen grinder (Oster, model 869-50R, Lakewood, CA, USA). Extraction of lipid fraction of the pumpkin seeds was performed using petroleum ether as a solvent in a Soxhlet extractor, according to AOAC procedure [ 23]. The extract was dried over Na 2SO 4, and then the solvent was evaporated under reduced pressure using a rotary evaporator (Büchi Rotavapor B-480, Essen, Germany) at 40 °C. Finally, the residue was weighed and dissolved in hexane. The recovered oil was stored at 4 °C until use.
